key_points: FOX 13 News confirmed Gabby Petito was last seen at a Fairfield Inn and Suites near Salt Lake City International Airport on August 24.
Hotel staff reported that the FBI and police officers recently visited the hotel and confirmed Gabby stayed there for more than a day.
The search for Gabby Petito has shifted focus to Wyoming, following her last known communications.
James Schmidt, Petito's stepfather, emphasized law enforcement's efforts in the search and their collective work.
Richard Stafford, a spokesman for the Petito family, criticized Brian Laundrie for not cooperating with the police.
Brian Laundrie, Gabby's boyfriend, has been named a person of interest but not a suspect in her disappearance.
Laundrie returned home in early September without Petito and has since hired a lawyer and refused to cooperate with police.
Gabby Petito was reported missing on September 11.
